title: Fundamental Concepts
description: Core principles of quantum mechanics and quantum information theory.

items.title: Quantum Mechanics Basics
items.description: Understanding quantum computing starts with grasping the fundamental principles of quantum mechanics.

concepts.title: Wave-Particle Duality
concepts.description: Learn how quantum objects exhibit both wave and particle properties, forming the foundation of quantum behavior.

concepts.title: Uncertainty Principle
concepts.description: Explore Heisenberg's uncertainty principle and its implications for quantum information processing.

concepts.title: Quantum States
concepts.description: Understand how quantum systems are described by state vectors in complex vector spaces.

concepts.title: Probability Amplitudes
concepts.description: Discover how quantum probabilities arise from complex amplitudes and Born's rule.

items.title: Qubits & Superposition
items.description: The quantum bit (qubit) is the fundamental unit of quantum information, capable of existing in superposition states.

concepts.title: Bloch Sphere
concepts.description: Visualize qubit states using the Bloch sphere representation and understand geometric interpretations.

concepts.title: Superposition States
concepts.description: Learn how qubits can exist in combinations of |0⟩ and |1⟩ states simultaneously.

concepts.title: Quantum Interference
concepts.description: Explore how quantum amplitudes can interfere constructively or destructively.

items.title: Quantum Entanglement
items.description: Explore the mysterious quantum phenomenon that Einstein called 'spooky action at a distance'.

concepts.title: Bell States
concepts.description: Study the four maximally entangled two-qubit states that form the foundation of quantum protocols.

concepts.title: Non-locality
concepts.description: Understand how entangled particles exhibit correlations that violate local realism.

concepts.title: Entanglement Measures
concepts.description: Explore mathematical tools to quantify and characterize entanglement in quantum systems.
